result.execSummary:
The defendant Quentin B. WOOD was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution will be capped at $10,000.00.  The $5,000.00 cash bail will be applied once the stipulation and order is drafted and signed by the court.
The Court further orders that court ordered financial obligations be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  The balance remaining at release from prison to be paid as a condition of extended supervision at a rate detemined by the supervising agent.
Maintain fulltime employment or job search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Sex offender treatment.

Comply with all requirements of the Sex Offender Registry.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

No contact with the victim, S.M.E., DOB: 03-27-1992 or her family.

No contact with anyone under the age of 18 unless approved by the agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

JURY TRIAL - DAY TWO 
Instruction conference held on the record.
Closing arguments of counsel given.
Jury deliberates from 10:05 a.m. to 1:07 p.m.
The jury finds the defendant guilty of all three counts. 
The Court accepts the jurys verdicts and enters judgment of conviction on all counts.
State moves to revoke bail.  Defense objects.
Court orders bail revoked.  State to prepare order.

ISSUES PRIOR TO TRIAL - 
The State files an Amended Information which amends the violation dates on all three counts to on or about 03-06-2006 through 03-21-2006.
The parties stipulate to the accuracy of the transcripts of two audio recordings of phone calls and while they are being played, the transcripts may be published to the jury.
The Court accepts the stipulation of the parties.
Amended Information.

The parties indicate thre is no agreement and are asking to proceed to trial.  
Court grants State's Motion in Limine and the use of expert testimony.   Defense does not object.

Stipulation and Order to Modify Bail Conditions.
It is hereby ordered as follows:
1) The defendant is allowed to travel to a wedding in Denver, Colorado from August 13, 2014 returning to the State of Wisconsin on August 16, 2014 with the defendant reporting to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department by 6:00 p.m. on Sunday, August 17, 2014.  This modification to bail conditions shall be effective upon the filing of this order.
2) that in all other respects, the defendant's cash bail bond dated January 13, 2014 as subsequently amended, shall remain in full force and effect.
Copy delivered to jail.

records.addlTxt:
An offer was extended by the State.  It have not been accepted.  The defendant requests a trial.

BAIL MODIFICATION MOTION - 
The defendant is requesting approval for travel to the State of Washington from 05-14-14 through 05-19-14.
The Court grants the motion and will allow the defendant to travel out of State on 05-14-14 through 05-19-14 to the State of Washington.  The Court orders the defendant to report to the Manitowoc County Jail before midnght on 05-19-14 to confirm that he has returned.  All other conditions remain in effect.  
Amended bail bond executed.

Stipulation and Order to Modify Bail Conditions.
It is hereby ordered as follows:
1) that the stipulation of the parties to modify the bail conditions of the defendant in case no: 14 CF 28 is approved, specifically allowing the defendant to have contact with additional persons under the age of 18, namely K.R.B., DOB: 05-15-07 and K.M.B., DOB: 10-03-11, so long as said contact is supervised by an adult.  This modification to bail conditions shall be effective upon the filing of this order.
2) That in all other respects, the cash bail bond dated 01-13-14 shall remain unchanged and in full force and effect to all other bail conditions.
Copy of Order delivered to jail.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 02-06-14 at 2:00 p.m.  
Minutes.

Authorization to Appear and Act; Notice of Motion and Motion for Discovery and Inspection; Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
Cover Letter.
At 2:47 p.m., $5,000.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of repeated acts of sexual assault of a child.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 01-27-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 cash with the conditions that he must surrender his passport, if he has one, to the Clerk of Court office within 48 hours of release, that he have no contact with S.M.E., DOB: 03-27-1992 and no contact with anyone under the age of 18, except his own children and that he not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior court approval.  Cash bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
